channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: Three new cases in NZ, two further deaths reported
item.description: Three new cases of Covid-19 have been reported in NZ in the past 24 hours, with the Health Ministry also confirming two further deaths from the coronavirus. Watch the latest update here.

item.title: Covid-19: Latest developments from New Zealand and around the world on 23 April
item.description: A 62-year-old Southland woman, whose family still don't know how she got Covid-19, has died from the coronavirus. Follow RNZ's live blog for the latest.

item.title: Hunting to be allowed on private land under Covid-19 alert level 3
item.description: Hunters will be able to resume their activities under level 3 as long as they have permission from the land owner, but this does not extend to public conservation land.

item.title: Controversial tech firm Palantir had talks with govt on Covid-19
item.description: The secretive US data-mining firm Palantir founded by Silicon Valley billionaire and NZ citizen Peter Thiel has had talks with the government here about combating Covid-19.

item.title: NZ-US couple stuck in visa limbo in Aotearoa
item.description: Donald Trump's immigration suspension has made the situation harder for a NZ-US couple stranded in NZ.

item.title: Covid-19: Traveller in isolation says enforcement of social distancing rule lacking
item.description: A returned traveller is worried that socialising going on under mandatory isolation could increase the risk of spreading Covid-19.

item.title: Covid-19: Customs investigates Ruby Princess
item.description: Customs is leading an investigation into the Ruby Princess cruise ship's visit to New Zealand, which is responsible for a cluster of 22 Covid-19 cases in the country.

item.title: Covid-19: Study investigates NZ reaction to government's strict laws
item.description: New Zealanders seem to welcome the government's strict Covid-19 rules, and it will be interesting to see if that changes as alert levels drop, a psychology researcher says.

item.title: NZ plane to fly out of New Delhi this Friday, but at a cost
item.description: Almost a month after other countries started repatriating their citizens from India, the New Zealand government is this week getting its first plane out of India off the ground.

item.title: Family of critically ill woman in Invercargill unsure how they got Covid-19
item.description: An Invercargill woman fighting for her life - and five of her family members - still don't know how they got Covid -19.

item.title: Covid-19: Many early childhood centres likely to remain shut at alert level 3
item.description: Health fears and lack of demand are likely to keep many early childhood centres shut when schools partially reopen next week.

item.title: The NZ doctor aboard the cruise ship with more than 100 Covid-19 cases
item.description: A Hawke's Bay-based man was the expedition doctor for a cruise, which ended up with more than half of the passengers contracting Covid-19.

item.title: Cancer sufferer in limbo as surgery pushed back in Covid-19 crisis
item.description: The Whanganui man joins others facing a potentially fatal wait as resource-reallocations cause surgeries to be cancelled.

item.title: Calls and txts to mental health line almost doubles
item.description: Calls and texts to the government's free national mental health helpline have risen sharply since the start of alert level 4.

item.title: Pandemic's challenges: Promotion agency faces cost-cutting measures
item.description: Christchurch's economic development agency is looking at cost cutting measures, at the same time as it grapples with planning the city's economic recovery from Covid-19.

item.title: Covid 19: What happened in New Zealand on 22 April
item.description: Another Rosewood rest home resident has died, data shows Kiwis are mostly abiding the rules, and a DHB blames a PPE breach for Covid-19 infections among staff.

item.title: Man charged with murder after death at Auckland brothel
item.description: Police have charged a 60-year-old man with murder over the death of Zion Gutnik, whose body was found at an Auckland brothel last month.

item.title: GPs fear for jobs, midwives feel ignored from government support
item.description: Community healthcare providers say they are being shortchanged during the Covid-19 crisis, and it'll be services that suffer.
